p: Fennel ( Foeniculum V ulgare Mill.) is an aromatic plant, which is widely used as a food additive and for medicinal purposes (Malhotra, 2012). While all parts of the plant are important in the medicinal industry, fennel seeds are mostly used to extract essential oils (Malhotra, 2012). trans‐Anethole (TA), estragole, and fenchone are the main components of the fennel seed essential oils (Díaz‐Maroto et al., 2006). Fennel is a potent antioxidant (Goswami & Chatterjee, 2014) and also exerts anti‐inflammatory, anti‐bacterial, anti‐fungal, and anti‐parasitic effects (Asmat et al., 2016; Malhotra, 2012; Oktay et al., 2003). Studies have also reported hepatoprotective effects of fennel in various liver injuries (Ozbek et al., 2003; Parsaeyan, 2016).
